Reviews.Title: Moto Tundra VA76r Review
Reviews.Author: G. Barnes
Reviews.Content: The Motorola Tundra is a great phone! It's been 4 months in my possession now and has seen some tough times, including putting me through the most embarrassing situation of my life. I work as an IT Manager and required a cell phone that would take a licking and keep on ticking. I brought the Tundra with a clip-on holder for the phone and my thinking at the time was quick access instead of a leather case that would wear down in no time.The Tundra has fallen many times in the short 4 months and in one case while passing between two people, one was holding her door open with her elbow sticking out. The Antenna on the Tundra somehow managed to hook on her elbow and fall out of the holder. I should have simply let the phone fall to the ground instead of trying to prevent it from falling, to the ground. I honestly don't know how I managed to grab a hold of this woman's ass three, or four times in the process of trying to catch my phone mid-air. Clearly, I was red with embarrassment and I could see she felt sorry for me and now I don't have to be on that show, "I Shouldn't Be Alive!"The Tundra's software, though basic is very well thought out and easily allows you to select the desired functions without needing to guess at the next step.The Tundra is hard pressed to loose signal and I have never missed a call. In Network Settings, the Tundra allows you to turn on Service Tone which alerts you when the phone has either lost signal and regained signal.The Tundra also allows you to set up to three different Alarms with very flexible parameters, including days of the week, weekends, etc.The Tundra's contact address book is not at all disappointing and gives you the ability to enter a wealth of information on your contacts while integrating itself very well with both incoming, outgoing and missed calls.Now, while my colleagues point, laugh, and joke about how I have to find a corner to answer my phone, I'm comfortable with the idea that the Tundra accepts and knows it's primary function is to be a Cell Phone and a tough one at that. I'm down with that.

Reviews.Title: Best Phone I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Bcentsale "bcentsale"
Reviews.Content: I've owned my Tundra for almost 3 years, and plan on keeping it as long as possible.  No, it's not razor-thin, but with regular use I've gone as long as a week between chargings, while my work-issued Samsung Galaxy barely lasts a day with every configurable feature turned off.  Additionally, with the external antenna I still get 2-3 bars in a datacenter filled with servers and other interference, in a geographic area where I hear constant complaints regarding reception OUTSIDE the building.The call / reception quality is amazing, as is the speakerphone function.  I have a pop-out cup holder in my dashboard (German's are not big on their venti grande lattes while driving) which serves as a dock for the phone if I need to talk while driving.  On AT&T;'s network it has a push-to-talk feature, but I have so many unused minutes I think it's stupid to pay extra for that.I purchased the phone when I was a logistics manager in a warehouse, and it has been been dropped on every surface imaginable, without a scratch.  The buttons are large enough that someone with big hands (like myself) or someone wearing gloves can still make a call or even send a text message.  My two children (as of this review, ages 1 and 3) have gotten hold of the phone numerous times, and even used it to teeth, and it still looks / works like it's brand new.Yes, it only has a 2mp camera, but I own more photographic equipment than I can keep track of, and pocket-sized digital 'daily-shooters' start at a such low price for still-decent quality that there should be no reason to take pictures with a phone.  Ever.  I can't make a phone call with your Olympus E-3, and you shouldn't take a picture with your phone.  I hope when this phone goes that AT&T; still offers something like it.  This is my 3rd Moto clamshell phone (what can I say, I'm a purist!)

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my husband who breaks everything!
Reviews.Author: Michelle R. Hill
Reviews.Content: This phone is perfect for my husband who breaks everything. He had the samsung rugby but hated it because he is a little technologically challenged. This phone is tough and easy to use. He loves it!!

Reviews.Title: Motorola Tundra
Reviews.Author: tom in maine
Reviews.Content: Great phone. Rugged and perfect for the woods and water. Who needs all those apps? Live in the real world.

Reviews.Title: Love this big phone
Reviews.Author: Gregory Molesan
Reviews.Content: Worth the high price. Had a Samsung Rugby killed it it 2 months. I have a swimming pool business and am very hard on phones. This is the best one yet.

Reviews.Title: Tundra is the best.
Reviews.Author: Sandra Nacquin "snacq64"
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my husband. He LOVES this phone. Bigger and heavier than most phones but he doesn't mind. He likes the ruggedness of this phone plus it is loaded with great features too.

Reviews.Title: Best phone service I've ever received
Reviews.Author: Water Lover "Marty"
Reviews.Content: The tundra is heavy duty and rugged, as described.  In addition, it has the external antenna so service bars for AT&T; are maximized.  Perfect for my husband who works outside.  Easy to use, intuitive settings.  I would buy this product again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome so far!
Reviews.Author: Janette S Jones
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my husband and he is pleased as punch.  We live and work in very remote areas and he's very happy with the reception the phone gets.  As long as he can keep from dropping it into a water bucket or trough, we think it will hold up to his rugged lifestyle.

Reviews.Title: Dynamite
Reviews.Author: Christina Carter
Reviews.Content: I really think it would take dynamite to cause a Tundra not to work. I have had it four years. This is my first experience with Motorola. I have dropped it on the concrete garage floor from 3' up; it still works. I have dropped it in the toilet; it still works. I have accidently stepped fully on it (200#); it still works. I have ran over it in the garage; it still works. It is surrounded with rubber so that, when it falls, no matter which angle it lands on it rolls over, the phone isn't even scratched, and it still works. I bike a lot and keep my phone in my pocket. As I pedal, the motion works the phone out of my pocket. It has landed in the middle of the road, bounced and rolled over but, you guessed it, it still works with no physical or internal damage. It is awesome!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Best phone for the money
Reviews.Author: Rian L. Peters "technician"
Reviews.Content: As this is one of my fourth cell phones in the last 15 years, it has lasted the longest.  My only complaint is the static on the line during 1/4 of the incomming calls.  I think this is more to do with the local cell tower, because there are no static problems in other areas.  I am so pleased with my Tundra VA76r, I am ordering another today.  I can not find a compariable phone on the AT&T; web sight so I am purchasing a new phone with no new contract on amazon.com.  AT&T; only offers two rugged phones and one is out of stock.  I have a rugged snap on case, and have dropped this phone many of times.  It is bluetooth ready, so I would like to try an ear piece.  I am on my third battery, so I will try an order a spare, as this phone seems to becomming obsolete.  I do not like the need for a data plan so this is also a good reason to pay full price for this phone.  My original VA76r cost $100.+ so paying $200.+ for a phone is simple math.  At $30.00 a month for a data plan it only take a few month to pay for this phone.  Hope Motorola or Samsung reads this as there needs to be some more options when it comes to those of us whom need a rugged phone and no data plan.  InMrFixIt

Reviews.Title: Excellent Service
Reviews.Author: John Mackey
Reviews.Content: Wireless Experts Inc was a great company to buy from! Would most definitely buy from them again or recommend people to buy from them! Received great service and advice from them, Originally ordered the Motorola Tundra and the customer service rep I talked to on the phone recommended I go with the Samsung Rugby instead even though it was 100 dollars cheaper. Great Service and Great purchase overall, had my phone within a day of ordering it!!! Definitely recommended to anyone looking to purchase a phone or any other like products!!!

Reviews.Title: It's what I wanted
Reviews.Author: David Stange
Reviews.Content: I have had no problems with the Motorola Tundra that I received, it does what I need it to do.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: lyman lawyer sr.
Reviews.Content: The Motorola Tundra VA76r is a very good simple phone.  It has good features and the reception Great. I would recommend this product to a good friend.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Petrisor Dragomir
Reviews.Content: Arrived in time before New Year. I'm very satisfied with it. I bought it mainly for reception and it works great. Reception is much better than the Samsung mini Galaxy3 I had before.

Reviews.Title: not what promised in add.
Reviews.Author: bob jones
Reviews.Content: Phone was sold as "new" and its used.. AT&T; says 2 other numbers were attached to this phone...phone works most of the time, but in the middle of a call lasting a couple of minutes the phone just shuts off. also want let you save numbers to the memory card..

Reviews.Title: Durable
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: My husband refuses to ever upgrade to any other phone. We had to buy a replacement of his original tundra...not because of water damage or being dropped one to many times but because he dropped it on the big island on a mission and a humvee ran over it...two times, and only damaged the screen :)

Reviews.Title: Update
Reviews.Author: Dana M. Libby "Sepere aude"
Reviews.Content: As I mentioned earlier I had bought two and one had a defective microphone and I sent it back.The replacement has made it's way to me promptly and with no defects.The sound is great and the casing sturdy. These were resons for me to purchase the pair in the first place.My nieghbor came over to borrow the phone and is amazed at the quality and the sound of the Tundra.Three Tundras, with one that was defective and replaced immediately with no hassles, and four people that love the phone.

Reviews.Title: Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: Willie R. Epperson
Reviews.Content: I like the phone, but I had to send it back to have it reprogram, couldn't if it help much. I might get another I don't know yet.

Reviews.Title: Best Signal
Reviews.Author: Wendy K. Weisenburn "Unknown"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my uncle who often works in areas where cell phone reception is spotty at best.  He needs his phone for his job and it needs to work.  We tried other phones that reviews said worked great in such areas, and they failed.  This one works! In fact, it works so well that we soon purchased a second one as a backup in case they get more difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: Tundra VA76r
Reviews.Author: Thomas Gari
Reviews.Content: Took forever to recieve 3 weeks past delievery promise, Worked as expected as this was my second phone. It has been less than a year and the hing on the right side has failed again the phone is junk. The first phone I had like this one failed in the same way, but saw more abuse. This one just flat faile after bein dropped from standing height. THere Mil-Std-80 test for robustness, but that just not the case. I would not buy another Tundra twice burned three time your a fool.

Reviews.Title: just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Penny Riggall
Reviews.Content: this is what I wanted and it is replacing one that the husband has had for a few years and can not buy them anymore

Reviews.Title: Best military specification phone on the market
Reviews.Author: Richard W. Harold
Reviews.Content: I've owned a Motorola Tundra VA76r for more than 3 years. It still works flawlessly. Unfortunately, Motorola stopped manufacturing the phone and AT&T; stopped selling it. I'm so happy with the phone that I decided to purchase a brand NEW backup Tundra to keep as a spare for when my current phone finally stops working. The way it's still working, I'm expecting to get several more years of usage. But now I'll have my NEW backup phone available when nedded. I really don't understand why Motorola decided to stop manufacturing it. There is no current replacement on the market built to military specifications that withstands drops, accidents, and is waterproof. I highly recommend this phone to anyone looking for a rugged phone built for long term usage. Be aware that the phones offered on this website are way overpriced and some are NOT new. I bought my brand NEW phone in original AT&T; packaging on another website whose ititials are "eb" for only $169. I checked "eb" today, and the same seller is now selling the same NEW phone for $219. That's still cheap for such a great quality phone that is brand new!

Reviews.Title: Phone broke after 6 weeks of Use
Reviews.Author: Jonesie "Jonesie"
Reviews.Content: I don't recommend buying this phone from the seller.  Sells Faulty phones.  I have had 4 tundras and this one is the worse I have seen.  This was the first time that I purchased a phone from this seller.  I never write reviews but I think other people should know.  This will save you the heartache I am feeling.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: Mark McLarty
Reviews.Content: Thanks again for standing behind your product. I was very pleased with your return and replace time. Merry Christmas to all.

Reviews.Title: Ordered for a friend
Reviews.Author: Johnny Murad
Reviews.Content: Ordered this phone for a friend.  He is very happy with his replacement phone and will use this one until it bombs out and will order another one just like it....He is VERY satisfied with his Motorola!

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: EMT/Firefighter "Harry"
Reviews.Content: This is my third one. I work where cell phones take abuse and this one can take it. My last one worked until it was broken in two.

Reviews.Title: horrible quality
Reviews.Author: Amy Footit
Reviews.Content: This phone has the worst quality that I have encountered. You are able to hear everything that the other person is saying; however, you sound like you are talking through two pillows. Noone is able to HEAR what you are saying to them.

Reviews.Title: Over Priced, Over Rated.
Reviews.Author: allenyk2000
Reviews.Content: I Do not recommend, Screen to small for GPS use, On phone ring tones are few and annoying. 3G is slow. The Motorola V365 BLK is a smaller version of this phone, no 3G but for the price is a better deal.
